items.title: Following Fireworks, Natural Gas Markets Fizzle at Year’s End
items.summary: After an early pullback Wednesday, February Nymex natural gas futures extended losses into the settlement amid light holiday trading, as moderating storage erosion and persistently mild weather forecasts reinforced expectations for softer winter dema

items.title: Natural Gas Forwards Strengthen on January Cold Risk
items.summary: With extended forecasts teasing the potential for nasty cold in mid-to-late January, natural gas forward prices posted front-weighted gains during the Dec. 23–30 trading period despite a less supportive near-term weather outlook.

items.title: Midday Natural Gas Futures Falter After Bearish Inventory Print
items.summary: Natural gas futures traded substantially lower in early afternoon action on Wednesday as market participants digested a seasonally light storage pull.

items.title: Global Natural Gas Prices Fizzle as More LNG Hits the Market, Demand Softens
items.summary: Global benchmark natural gas prices are ending the year at levels last seen before the 2022 invasion of Ukraine. As seasonal temperatures turn toward the milder side in Europe, the February Title Transfer Facility contract sank to around $9.66 by mid

items.title: Seasonal Demand Swings, Increasing LNG Supplies Pose Risks for U.S. Feed Gas Demand in 2026
items.summary: U.S. LNG feed gas is up by nearly 5 Bcf/d as the year comes to a close and peaked at 18.8 Bcf/d in December, according to NGI data.

items.title: Lean Storage Report Keeps Pressure on Natural Gas Futures
items.summary: Utilities withdrew a net 38 Bcf of natural gas from storage in the week ended Dec. 26, the U.S. Energy Information Administration (EIA) reported on Wednesday. The result fell far short of historical norms for this time of year and weighed on Nymex na

items.title: Western Canada Natural Gas Prices Sag on Mild Weather, Strong Supplies
items.summary: Record production and warmer weather in the second half of December have sent Western Canada’s natural gas benchmark, AECO, falling into the year-end.

items.title: Legal Fights Over LNG Exports Intensify as Activists Reopen Commonwealth, Rio Grande Cases
items.summary: Environmental opponents of U.S. natural gas exports are back on the offensive with a slate of state and federal permit challenges for two Gulf Coast projects already under development.

items.title: Is the Appalachian Basin Poised for a New Growth Era as More Natural Gas Pipelines, Data Centers Advance?
items.summary: After years of stagnant production and prices, growth prospects have again emerged in the Appalachian Basin that could revive the kind of activity that characterized the region when it ascended during last decade’s unconventional drilling boom.

items.title: Argentina’s Shale Boom Propels It Past Colombia in Oil Output
items.summary: Argentina, in a surprise development, overtook Colombia to become South America’s fourth-largest oil producer. The country is undergoing a once-in-a-generation unconventional hydrocarbon boom, which began with Buenos Aires nationalizing integrated en

items.title: US Crude, Product Inventories Rise Again
items.summary: The American Petroleum Institute (API) estimated that crude oil inventories in the United States saw a build of 1.7 million barrels in the week ending December 26. Crude oil inventories rose by 2.4 million barrels in the week prior. Crude oil invento

items.title: Big Oil Prepares for Leaner Prices and Harder Choices in 2026
items.summary: Several trends emerged in the energy markets in 2025 and are set to continue shaping the global oil, gas, and energy equities markets into 2026. Sure, there will be many wild cards in 2026, especially concerning geopolitics and tensions flaring up fr

items.title: Blockade Slows Exports but Tankers Still Drift Toward Venezuela
items.summary: Oil tankers are still making their way to Venezuela despite Washington’s naval blockade, a sign that Caracas is leaning harder on floating storage and debt-linked crude shipments even as its export system begins to clog. At least two tankers arrived

items.title: Will Saudi Arabia/UAE Tensions Over Yemen Threaten OPEC Status Quo?
items.summary: The latest flare-up between Saudi Arabia and the United Arab Emirates over Yemen looks dramatic on the surface, but OPEC cohesion, not missiles or militias, is what ultimately matters to the oil markets, which is why the latest public spat between Sa

items.title: Russia’s Pipeline Gas Sales to Europe Plunge to 50-Year Low
items.summary: Russia’s pipeline gas exports to Europe collapsed by 44% in 2025, falling to their lowest level since the mid-1970s, according to Reuters calculations. The drop marks the clearest statistical endpoint yet for what was once Moscow’s most lucrative and
